title: Why are strings immutable in Java?

answers.junior: Strings are immutable to make them safe and secure. Once created, their value cannot be changed. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: String immutability enables string pool optimization, thread safety, and security for sensitive data. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Hash code caching improves performance in collections.
answers.senior: Immutability provides security (class loading, reflection), thread safety without synchronization, and enables string interning for memory optimization. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Trade-off is new object creation for modifications.
